googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmNotes: If your municipal clerk has a fax machine, you may fax this application to the clerk but must also mail completed VBM application with your original signature, either separately or with your absentee ballot. If VBM application with your original signature is not received by the close of the polls on Election Day, primary, or referendum, your absentee ballot will not be counted.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsSdr: Bring your Connecticut driver's license or state ID card with you. If you don't have one, bring ONE photo ID that shows your name, and ONE document that shows your name and current address.  Acceptable documents include a utility bill, bank statement, paycheck, residential lease, or any government document that shows your name and address.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox6: Connecticut Driver's License Number, or if none, the last four digits of your Social Security Number.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.vbmAbsenteeBallotRules:
* For the November 3, 2020 election, all registered voters will receive an **absentee ballot application** via the mail. All postage will be paid for by the Office of the Secretary.
* You will need to provide an excuse to vote by mail in Connecticut, but 100% of voters can use COVID-19 as an excuse. 
* If you are requesting an absentee ballot due to COVID-19, you must check the "My Illness" excuse on the absentee ballot request form.

googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsInPersonVoting: All Connecticut voters must show ID that includes photo or signature or home address.  Acceptable photo ID would include a drivers license from any state, a US passport, a military ID card, a tribal ID card, a student ID card, an employee ID card, or any other government issued photo ID. Acceptable non-photo ID would include a social security card, or a recent utility bill, bank statement, government check, paycheck, or other government document that shows name and Connecticut address.

googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationNvrfBox7: Connecticut has a closed primary system. You must register with a politcal party if you wish to vote in that party's primary elections.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsOvr: You can register to vote online if you have a Connecticut driver's license or state ID card. If not, you can still register to vote by mail or in person.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.idRequirementsVbm: Connecticut voters do not need to provide ID when voting by mail.
googleSheetVaApiDataRow.registrationRules:
To register in Connecticut you must:

  * be a citizen of the United States
  * be a resident of Connecticut and of the town in which you wish to vote
  * be 17 years old. You can vote when you turn 18.
  * have completed confinement and parole if previously convicted of a felony
  * not currently be declared mentally incompetent to vote by a court of law
